name: BEST WESTERN PLUS The Tuscan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: room was quiet, clean with good beds but very very small
reviews.title: liked it

reviews.text: not a cheap hotel
reviews.title: Awesome hotel!!

likes.liked: — the quaintness and beauty of the hotel inside
likes.disliked: — I thought the front desk staff could have been a bit more cheery!

reviews.text: valit parking was to much expencive but oke its the location
reviews.title: Liked staying at Tuscon Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this Tuscan Inn in the Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco recently. What a lovely place in the midst of a fast-paced environment! The thought that it was a Best Western made me think ahead of my stay that this is an okay place to rest a night but what a surprise when I found the cutest place in the City of San Francisco. The room was adorable and had everything I needed. The concierge, Hugo Vides, is the absolute best. The welcoming wine event between 5 and 6 p.m. was a nice twist to get to know others who were staying there. I only wish I would have had more time there and hope to someday return. I am so glad my travel agent at Liberty Travel suggested this.
reviews.title: Cozy, friendly place to stay on the wharf

likes.disliked: — The price and the parking are very expensive

reviews.text: I booked this hotel via booking.com at KLM website. I went through a lot of reviews and the one from Frommers Guide was most helpful. I got a good rate and no prepayment from the KLM website( linked to booking.com). Tuscon Inn was near the pier 39, which is a great location, checking in and out was easy. The staff were very helpful. The room was nice, good size and quite clean. The bathroom was big and clean as well. Although I was alone, room was good enough for a couple. The hotel had free coffee and drinks everyday and free access to wireless internet. The adjacent served nice breakfast. Great location and hotel. Try and not book anything from the hotel though, just walk up pier 39 and you will have more choice. The hotel does arrange a shuttle to the airport without any extra charge.
reviews.title: Nice, Convenient Hotel

likes.liked: — Convenient and nice room once moved from original shabby room and internet

reviews.text: I will be back! I have been staying in San Fran for a while as i visit my college aged son. This hotel is the first i have felt totally comfortable in. The staff is friendly and the hotel itself is not what it appears from the outside. The Kimpton Group has taken it over and i believe, have given it a shakedown.....down comforters......gorgeous lobby and friendy restaurant and lounge. The food at the "Cafe" is quite "hotel-like" but the service makes up for it.....plus SF is a food town! So many other places to explore other than your hotel!
reviews.title: Just returned

reviews.text: This place geets major reccomendations from me. I will stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and brilliant location near Fishermans Wharf
Loved it
reviews.text: Stayed at the Best Western Fishermans Wharf Hotel in June 2005 and really loved everything about it. A warm welcome on arrival and a nice suite although the rooms were quite compact, however I understand this is common in Fishermans Wharf . Our suite was located on the inner courtyard of the Hotel and lovely and quiet away from any possible traffic noise. Can highly recommend the Restaurant attached to the Hotel for both breakfast and dinner. All in all a great Hotel to stay in at a reasonable cost close to all the action on Fishermans Wharf.

reviews.title: The good outweighed the bad
reviews.text: Free internet use in the reception area was a great touch.

Recently stayed at the Tuscan Inn and had a great experience. The staff were helpful, it was in a great location, and was very charming. The complimentary evening wine reception was great, a nice chance to find out what's good or not good to do. Will probably stay when return in May.
reviews.title: a great 5 days
great hotel
reviews.text: Great hotel, nice location for everything! Very clean, get a glass of wine free between 5&6pm in the lobby. Get an internal top floor room if you can, no noise from traffic or people upstairs. There's no view anyway so best to get some peace and quiet (no that it a noisy hotel anyway). Also book Alcatraze trip as soon as you get there (from Pier 31 I think it was) as it gets busy days in advance.
Just got back from a recent trip to San Francisco. Stayed at the Tuscan Inn near Fisherman's Wharf and it was excellent.
reviews.title: Great rooms; great staff; great hotel

reviews.text: Tuscan Inn has exceptionally helpful and friendly staff. There was never a time where I saw the concierge desk unstaffed. In fact, the concierges seemed to be the busiest people in the hotel; always assisting someone with a reservation, recommendation, a jogging route, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent location, friendly staff, clean and pleasant rooms

likes.disliked: — Had some trouble using PC in business center, but helpful staff got us refund AND let us use their computer!

reviews.text: The hotel had nIce, well-decorated, fairly-modern rooms. Some of the common spaces are a little worn but our king guest room was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

likes.liked: — The room decor with shutters was great.

reviews.text: OK... this is Fisherman's Wharf so there are some obnoxious, tourist-trap activities around. But.. the hotel is also only a few blocks from North Beach where we found some great little restaurants and cafes.
reviews.title: Loved the Tuscan Inn San Francisco

likes.liked: — Atmosphere, and attitude of the staff

reviews.text: My husband & I spent the day in San Fran. We stopped there before our week long trip to Napa. It was wonderful. The rooms were great and the Service wonderful. They did have a Wine/Beer serving at 5pm which was nice. It is located 2 blocks from the wharf which was outstanding considering parking is hard to come by. The only complaint I have is the Valet service. Not that it was horribly but the pull in nook is not very big. We waited about 10 mins before being helped but we were on vacation, So what's the hurry, right??!
reviews.title: Great rooms,location & service
Great Room - Appalling Front Desk
reviews.text: Enjoy your stay. We did!

The rooms and building are quite nice - location is excellent. The front desk is the worst service I have had in years. It took 45 minutes to check in and we didn't wait in line. While we were waiting, the desk clerk stopped helping us to talk to other guests, never apologized for the interruption, and never looked up once. He was also training serveral others in the same manner - it was the night manager!!!!! Dreadful service!!!!
reviews.title: great location and reasonably priced
such nice folks
reviews.text: The rooms were clean and well appointed - the maid staff were excellent.

I just recieved my credit card bill, there are two extra charges for a total of $20.00. When I called, the desk clerk mumbled into the phone and I had to ask if I had the right number.. Then in a snotty tone, he imformed me that "you know, accounting is only here during the day." I would only stay here again if they changed management.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While looking for a romantic yet affordable place to take the love of my life for Valentine's day weekend, my search via the internet let me to the Best Western - Tuscan Inn. Although I had frequented San Francisco on many occasions, I had never even noticed this property, and I wanted this weekend to be the most romantic ever.
reviews.title: Perfect Romance in Tuscany

likes.liked: — The Service...Absolutely, The Staff Is The Best!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prior to our arrival, I had contacted the concierge' desk and asked them to arrange for roses to be waiting in the room, and for a limousine for dinner on Saturday evening. They said they could accomodate me.
reviews.title: Not cheap but worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon our arrival, we were directed to a "mini-suite" on the fourth (top) floor, southeastern corner of the hotel. Although it was not particular large, it had a quaint sitting room with a television, and coffee table, and the entire suite was very nicely decorated. This particular room had views of the Bay bridge, the Golden Gate bridge, and if we were sitting up in bed, we had a beautiful view of the bay and Fisherman's Wharf. There was a DVD copy of "Under the Tuscan Sun", which was a nice touch, although my girlfriend couldn't figure out why they left that particular movie. I explained to her that we were staying in the "Tuscan Inn!!!" We both had a good laugh, but never got to watch the movie.
reviews.title: Tiny Room
Great Location
reviews.text: The roses in the room were the most beautiful my love had ever seen, and were in a beautiful vase with the stems hidden by a giant leaf wrappped inside the clear vase. Excellent choice of florist by the hotel.

reviews.title: NIce Place
reviews.text: The evening Italian wine & beer reception was very nice, and complimentary for hotel guests. The limousine arrived on time, and the driver was very cordial and accomodating.

We're sitting in our hotel room, waiting for another set of towels (there are three of us and we were given towels for two). The ice machine is empty. The vending machine doesn't work. The concierge does not answer the phone. Exactly who runs this place!?!?!?!?!
reviews.title: Wonderful --- NOT!

reviews.text: From checkin to checkout, our stay was fabulous. The staff's professional, spirited attitude--be they reservationist, valet, front desk, or housekeeper--deserves 5 stars. For instance, mention in passing by one of us about an allergy to down brought an instant change of linens. The hotel's evening wine hour and morning's biscotti hour also distinguish the property as a cut above, and our group, which has stayed at many a biz hotel, had no problem whatsoever; in fact, a courtesy upgrade got us a fine meeting space with free internet, which even impressed our boss. And while we weren't expecting to dine at their restaurant, given how many fine ones there are to choose from in this neighborhood, as it turns out we relished the food, both dinner and breakfast. We're already planning our next stay.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: Just came back from a one night stay at the Tuscan Inn. Although we are "locals" having lived in SF Bay Area for the last 16 years, we were attending a wine event at Fort Mason and didn't want to have to drive home. When I got a GREAT deal ($99 INCLUDING parking!!!!) I jumped at it. But being the Wharf had no great expectations, and didn't really need much more than a bed for the night.
reviews.title: Great find in touristy Fishermans Wharf

likes.disliked: — Parking was not covered, but was a public lot across street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a weird hybrid.. calling itself Best Western, but being in partnership with Kimpton Hotels (which for those that don't know is a chain of more upscale boutique hotels). I have to think this is why the hotel looks and feels a lot better than other Wharf hotels I've stayed at previously. And frankly more upscale than other Best Westerns too.
reviews.title: Good Place, if you can get a Discount

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were very pleasant, always asking if we needed directions or anything (we didn't, but it's nice to be asked) and smiling and opening doors etc. (including all the maids and bell boys we encountered) Small touches, but very pleasant. We didn't make it to the wine hour (having been drinking wine all day, it was not high on our agenda!) but have done that at other Kimpton hotels and it's a nice extra.
reviews.title: Saved the Trip

reviews.text: We spent 2 weeks (which I gather is quite a long time!!!) at the Tuscan Inn in Sept 04 & had a great time.The hotel was lovely - really clean with friendly helpful staff & fantastically situated in between North Beach & Fishermans Wharf.
reviews.title: Fantastic San Fran !!

reviews.text: We had a room facing the inner courtyard on the first floor & found it both quiet & very comfortable.We really could not find any fault with either the hotel or San francisco at all, & would not hesitate to stay there again. ps....do not miss Alcatraz - book in advance !!!
reviews.title: A Bargain Hotel With Class

reviews.text: We spent 4 days at the Best Western Tuscan Inn, Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco the week before Christmas. I booked the room through Expedia, and because of this, the hotel wouldn't credit my Best Western Gold Card with either points or air miles. The price was great for a small but comfortable room. We did have a room on the 3rd floor over the sidewalk and street of North Point. The windows are crank operated, and thin, so there was some street noise from city buses from about 5:30 in the morning until about 10 at night. We are heavy sleepers and it didn't really bother us, as it seems to have bothered other reviewers. The hotel is an Italian mediterrean theme everywhere, entrance, lobby, garden courtyard, restaurant, and rooms. The staff are 100% present and attentive to your every need. Their friendliness reminded me very much of the Aloha spirit at Hawai`ian resorts and hotels. The lobby is small and cozy with a gas log fireplace, perfect for taking away the chill after those cool, foggy walks down to the waterfront. Guests actually talk to one another during morning coffee, and the free hour of wine at 5 pm. I highly recommend this hotel, for both quality and economy.
reviews.title: Excellent
top marks for the tuscan
reviews.text: We bought some of our food at one of the 3 grocery stores a block from the hotel. I'ts about 2 blocks to Fisherman's Wharf, 2 blocks to the cable car turn-around, 1 block to the F-Line trolley car, and 3 blocks to Pier 39. I liked to start and end my day walking out to the sea lions on the K pier at Pier 39. I also took the Blue and Gold ferry out to Alcatraz, and suggest everyone visiting S.F. see this sight for both the ferry boat ride, and for the rich history lesson. Another of my day trips was to rent a car and drive down to Monterrey Bay.

reviews.title: Convenient and well managed
reviews.text: Stayed here in November '04, and loved it! Convenient for all wharfs, and trips to Alcatraz. VERY helpful staff allowed us to check in 4 hours early, and continued to impress! Complementary wine tasting in the evening was a bonus too!! Recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 4 days. Our flight came in early so the room we requested wasn't ready yet. The concierge recommended a bus tour and called to see if there were seats available and booked us on the tour that was leaving in an hour. The tour was fabulous and the driver was wonderful and provided excellent information during the tour. The tour ended around 2:30 and we were dropped off back at the hotel. By this time our room was ready.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had asked for a courtyard room as I am a very light sleeper. I had no problem at all even though everything in San Francisco was booked and there were people everywhere due to it being the start of Fleet Week. The room was extremely clean and very spacious. The carpet was a bit worn and outdated but that isn't a complaint just an observation. We found the staff to be very helpful and courteous and we had no problems at all.
reviews.title: Just the Job

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't participate in the wine social that occurred everyday at 5 but there were a lot of people that did as every time we went through the lobby it was packed. We did however take advantage of the free coffee and biscotti that was offered every morning in the lobby.
reviews.title: Great time in San Fran

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a fantastic location just a 5 minute walk from Fisherman's Wharf and no more then 10 minutes from the cable cars and other attractions. There is an Ihop one block down which we ate at a couple of times.
reviews.title: Excellent service, great location, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was a pleasant one with no complaints at all. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great location and price

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for three days and then moved down the street to the Hyatt(also reviewed the Hyatt) for three days on our trip.This hotel was clean and in a excellent location to everything.The cable cars were one block behind the hotel,waterfront was two blocks in front of the hotel and the #10 bus to AT&T ballpark was right across the street from the main entrance.We arrived early in the morning and tried to check in and the front desk staff said they would have a room cleaned asap for us.We left and came back two hours later and room was still not ready.We had tickets to a 12:45pm Giants game and were hoping to get our room before going to the game.We were having a casual conversation with the concierge and mentioned this fact to him,he then said he'd see what he could do and had us checked into our room in minutes.The front desk staff didn't seem to care but the concierge who took care of us was great(there were two of them working different days)he also had many suggestions and tips for us about the Bay area.The only other negative and its a small one, was the size of the rooms,they are tiny but were cleaned well and were ready when we returned every day.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: A good location if you want to be walking distance to sights and transportation. The rooms were very nice, clean and comfortable. The 2-room suite was a little crowded, too much furniture, nicely done otherwise. It's walking distance to many sights,, as well as the cable car line,and the trolleys. Very convenient. Every day in the lobby: a very nice complimentary coffee and biscotti in the morning, and a wine tasting in the evening. Wifi was included if you have your own laptop, otherwise internet available in the lobby. The highlight of this hotel for us was the service offered by the staff, particularly the two concierges on duty while we were there. Their service was of the level and knowledge I would expect at at 5-star hotel. I had also called ahead for some information regarding bilingual tours (information I had a very hard time finding on the internet) , and everything was taken care of for us before we arrived.
reviews.title: Good Location, Great Value

reviews.text: Similar to some other disgruntled reviewers here I was assigned a different room than I had booked. There were three of us and I had booked a two double bed room and had a confirmation to prove it. I had chosen this hotel for that particular reason as I was having difficulty getting a two bed room at nearby wharf hotels. I was given a king room with a cot on check-in. After a few trips by the clerk back to the manager who remained out of site I was told I had not booked a double bed room but a double occupancy room which wasn't true. They said they noticed we had three people so had automatically provided a cot to our room, I was told they were full and there were no other rooms available.
reviews.title: Experienced the good and the bad

likes.disliked: — Mix-up with room, less than helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we got to our room the cot was already there but due to the small room I had to re-arrange furniture to get it to fit, in doing so having to re-assemble their cheap particle board table. The room faced a side street, the street directly below became very active at 5 am with motorcycles in particular in addition to trucks noisily heading up the street. I'm a sound sleeper normally and nothing wakes me so this was just a sign of how noisy it was.
reviews.title: A brilliant start to our vacation

reviews.text: I managed to get switched to a two double bed room for our next couple of nights and experienced what all the good reviewers must have. The room was significantly larger, still small but liveable, and although still on the 3rd floor it faced the wharf and what I would have thought was the busier street but the traffic was much quieter and I didn't hear much at all the next two mornings.
reviews.title: Check out the free wine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Tuscan Inn was in a great location a few minutes from Fisherman's Wharf. It was easy to walk to North Beach as well. We didnt' have a car, so we liked the fact it was a short walk to the cable car stop. The room was small, but clean, quiet, and suited our needs. The afternoon wine and cheese was a nice bonus as was the free Internet. The concierge at the hotel was extremely helpful and nice. He checked into baseball tickets, offered dinner reccomendations, and answered all of our san francisco questions.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Tuscan Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future. It was a great base to explore San Francisco.
reviews.title: A nice surprise.....

reviews.text: What can you say about a place that does not dazzle but delivers solid consistent performance.. The price was reasonable based on others in the vicinity and it does a good job. The room was clean, the staff was great and it was CLOSE to Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf (easy walk). I'd stay there again. The restaurant looks nice but I'm not a big Italian food fan so I bypassed the place. I went with average expectations and came away pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Fisherman's Wharf overrated

likes.liked: — The staff and free wine happy hour
likes.disliked: — The stinky bathroom and the trashy Fisherman's Wharf area.

reviews.text: Although we enjoyed our stay at the Tuscan Inn it wasn't all I'd hoped it would be. Probably because I was so disappointed in the Fisherman's Wharf area itself. It was really dirty, crowded, crime-ridden and touristy. The food was bad and overpriced in general. The only place I really liked were some of the places on Pier 39, but I wouldn't eat at a sit-down restaurant here. I would stay in North Beach or Sausalito next trip. Food in North Beach was fabulous!.
reviews.title: A Good hotel

reviews.text: As far as the hotel, the room was clean but small. Beds very comfortable - we had a King with pull-out sofa for our 12-yr-old son. Nice big flat screen tv. They comped us an in-room movie when I reported that it was "jerky". Bathroom shower curtain reeked of mildew enough to smell up the room. I should have had them take it down and wash it, but probably got used to it. Staff was great. Concierge very helpful.
reviews.title: Right position to visit SFO

reviews.text: Three friends and I just returned from Tuscan Inn, Fisherman's
reviews.title: Tuscan is Great Location

likes.disliked: — View of the wall from my window

reviews.text: Wharf, in San Francisco. We booked our reservation with Southwest Vacations. We had a great time and could have
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed longer. The room was very nice, and had a nice bathroom. We did have a wall view from the window, but since I was not in the room except to sleep I did not make a big fuss. It was nice having the Safeway store across the street to get snacks. I enjoyed the hot chocolate every morning in the lobby. The fireplace in the lobby was very pretty, and the courtyard flowers were beautiful. The location was perfect. Alot of other hotels were more expensive but we were very happy at the Tuscan. The desk clerks were nice and helpful. My friend celebrated his birthday there!
reviews.title: No Problems

reviews.text: We walked to a lot of places. It was very convenient. We did not have a car, hotel parking is expensive. We had a Tower Tour
reviews.title: OK but not as good as our last stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the first 3 days of our honeymoon beofre getting some sun in Palm Springs. The room was lovely and clean with everything you need wether on business or pleasure.
reviews.title: A nice hotel for a short getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff were extremely helpful and polite and always saying hi when eye contact was made.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: A good hotel in a good location for all the tourist attractions if you're walking, taxi or by bus.
reviews.title: Great hotel Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at the hotel restaurant on our first night which was value for money.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great experience!!

likes.disliked: — tea and coffee facilities, side table made from cheap chipboard hidden under a table cloth - but that's just nit picking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definately stay in this hotel again if we're ever in San Fran again.
reviews.title: some disappointments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I took a weekend trip up to San Francisco and wanted to stay at a place that was cheap and close to Fisherman's Wharf. This place did not disappoint.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: Our room was only $99 per night through some promotion found on Travelzoo. I figure you get what you pay for... but the room was actually pretty nice. There wasn't much of a view (I think the window faced the adjacent building) but the room was fairly large, clean, and the room (as well as the whole floor) was nice and quiet. There was a very private feel to the hotel.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: They also had a staffmember serve soda and wine in the loungy lobby area in the early evening, which was a nice bonus. The surrounding area of the hotel, to our surprise, seemed safe and relatively clean. But the location was great... just a few blocks from the touristy parts of the Wharf. Would definitely recommend this hotel for your next brief stay in the bay.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we just stayed at the tuscan inn for about 5 nights. it was definetely worth it. we had a great room, clean and spacious enough for 2 adults and 2 small kids. and the price was fantastic. we first booked thru hotels.com and thought we got a great deal..our sf itinerary changed a bit, and we needed another 2 nights at the tuscan inn, and the hotel said they would match our hotels.com price, they actually gave us a lower price than that! wow! all the staff we encountered were super friendly and the hotel location is great..enjoy your stay there, i'm sure you'll love it.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really enjoyed the atmosphere of the hotel. It was reasonable and close to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel offered coffee, tea, and biscotti in the morning and wine and an appetizer in the late afternoon. The staff were helpful and efficient. I had not stayed in a Best Western in a while, and I was very pleased.
reviews.title: Overall Excellence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and myself stayed at the Tuscan Inn 12/8-10. We absolutly loved the hotel and would stay again. Comfortable bed, staff was excellent....great get a way!!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in a suite at the Tuscan Inn the weekend before Thanksgiving. I certainly would recommend a suite for parties of 3 or more. (I traveled with my wife and teenage son.) The rooms' furniture and amenities were quite nice.
reviews.title: Lovely Evening

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The afternoon wine party was well-attended and pleasant. We had pizza hors d'oeuvres. The continental breakfast is inadequate (only tiny biscotti are provided).
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We ate dinner at the Cafe Pescatore (the on-line site restaurant). Our meals were OK; however, I have never been impressed with restaurants in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
reviews.title: Excellent Location!!

reviews.text: After dinner we walked to Pier 39 and enjoyed the sea lions and the atmosphere.
reviews.title: Loved Staying at the Tuscan Inn
Excellent !
reviews.text: Just returned from a week in San Francisco at the Tuscan Inn and thought I would give my views on an excellent stay.
Had picked this hotel on reviews on this site and a couple of others and I was pleased with my choice.
reviews.title: Loved the Tuscan Inn
Shattered our image of a Best Western
reviews.text: The room itself was medium size - we were on the 4th floor which was nice and quiet , the chiller was useful and the bed most comfortable - surprising for a hotel.

reviews.title: Easily Accessible to Wharf
reviews.text: The location is 1st class , a few minutes from the Wharf and all its attractions , and close to a Safeways Supermarket ( open 7 to 12 pm ) and handily placed for buses , trams and cable cars.

reviews.title: Clean and Close
reviews.text: The staff seemed pleasant and efficient whenever I had dealings with them , indeed the only quibble I had was that the bell boys at the front were a little undermanned on occasions but I will not let this alter my view of the hotel overall.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The valet's were a little slow and I hated the vulture baggage guy. I don't have a problem being helped up to the room although I;m fine doing it myself. This guy immediately put all my bags on the cart while I was pre-occupied with the valet but then while I was trying to correct the problems with the room at check-in he was impatiently trying to get us to hurry up in spite of me telling him just to leave the bags.
reviews.title: absolutely loved it

reviews.text: We read reviews on many hotels looking for above average accomodations in a convenient location. The Tuscan Inn fit that well. Very comfortable stay and got a good deal on Orbitz to boot. Only drawback is room size. We started w/ a king w/ sofa bed for my son but we were tripping on each other so we upgraded to a suite. We also moved from a street view room to a courtyard as the street noise was extremely loud. Staff was some of the nicest I have encountered in a long time. The concierge here was 1st class. Would highly remonmmend this hotel.
reviews.title: Very Nice --Would recommend to my friends
Wharf on one side, ghetto on other
reviews.text: On one side of the hotel was Fisherman's Wharf just a few blocks away. On the other was a kind of seedy area with lots of bums. The neighborhood the hotel is in wasn't the best. We always kept it in our heads that we should get back to the room before it got too late. There were some problems with people at the front desk, one younger guy (can't recall his name) was uncooperative and unprofessional. Our airconditioner wasn't in the best working order. We had a nice size room with 2 double beds. My parents' room with only one king bed was really small they wanted to change, but the hotel was booked up. Breakfast isn't included in the room rate, although there is a restaurant adjoined to the hotel with decent, average-priced food. I think it was around $10.00 for an omelette. We expected a better hotel and even thought "This is it" but it was reasonably princed. There are so many SF hotels, we should have taken more time to find a nicer place. It wasn't necessarily bad, just not any thing great, either.

Wife and I stayed at the Tuscan Inn from August 1-8. I chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor customer reviews. We were very pleased with our choice. The location is perfect. Five minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf, and a short walk to cable cars, busses, and many great restaurants. Staff and concierge were very helpful. We had a courtyard room and it was very quiet. Weather was very cool at night and we slept with the window slightly open. Very comfortable for sleeping and we never used the air conditioning, even though we are from Michigan and keep it on in our home for most of the summer (like today, when it is 90 and humid). The coffee and biscotti offered in the morning is a good way to start the day, and the free wine hour from 5 to 6 is very pleasant, although we were so busy we only attended twice. I would definately return to the Tuscan.
reviews.title: Good Choice
Great place to stay--Tuscan Inn
reviews.text: My 18-yr old dtr and I just returned from staying 4 nights at the Tuscan Inn in San Francisco. We had never traveled there and booked the trip thru Priceline. Tuscan was wonderful! The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The rooms were also quiet and we felt safe. The location was great, just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. One day we got a day pass and took the cable cars and buses to view other parts of the city such as Chinatown, Golden Gate Park, Painted Ladies houses. The bus line we needed was just across the street and the cable car was a block away. Again, the location was great! The 5-6 pm complimentary wine hour was a nice feature. They did have soda for younger people, but ran out so my dtr didn't get anything to drink. In the morning there is complimentary tea, coffee, hot chocolate and biscotti. We arrived at the Oakland Airport and took BART to get to SanFrancisco and then the f-line muni to get to Fisherman's Wharf. It was ok, but it took a good hour to get to our motel. It cost about $8 per person to travel this way. We decided to take a shuttle back to the Oakland Airpost. There was a shuttle that advertised $23 for one person and $10 for additional people...so it cost $33 which was worth it. It only took about 20-25 minutes by shuttle to get back to the Oakland Airport. I'd definately stay at the Tuscan Inn again. Other places I'd recommend seeing include Alcatraz (audio tour), Muir Woods tour, and biking the Golden Gate bridge.

We were very pleased with the Tuscan Inn. After going back and forth trying to decide whether to stay at the more expensive Argonaut, we chose the Tusan Inn and were very happy with the choice. It is set back just far enough from the wharf area that you feel you can get away from the tourist madhouse, but close enough that in five minutes you can be at pier 39 or the cannery. The location was great! We were able to hop on the cable car right around the coner, we walked to Lombard Street, Coit Tower, the square, the marina, and the wharf many times. The rooms were celan and well kept. The bathroom was just okay, but for the price we survived. The staff of the hotel was very friendly and the evening cocktail hour was a great touch with many choices.
reviews.title: Great deal with lots of charm
Not Impressed
reviews.text: We enjoyed a meal at the ajoining Pescatore's and found it to be affordable and delicious. The hotel is just across the way from Safeway, Trader Joe's, and Branes and Nobles. We were able to grab danish or donuts in the morning at Safeway which was a great way to save on money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will always come back to this hotel for business travel or for pleasure.I travel quite often and have stayed in many different hotels. Right now this hotel is at the top of my list. I will always tell everyone to try it.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel and location! Great city for couples

likes.liked: — Location, free MUNI passes each day for trolleys and buses

reviews.text: Loved the location of this hotel! It was near the ocean- about 2 blocks away. Location was also near Pier 39 (shopping, sea lions, and marina), Ghiradelli's chocolate factory, and Alcatraz. Lots of little shops nearby- very touristy. At Pier 39 the shops were nicer with a great outdoor atmosphere. Loved eating at Bubba Gump Shrimp Co.- as in Forest Gump. Great shrimp, fish, chicken fingers, hushpuppies, etc with lots of windows to enjoy the ocean and marina. The gift shop is great, too, if Forest Gump is one of your favorite movies like mine. My husband and I went for our anniversary and it was perfect. The Golden Gate Bridge is unbelievable! It just makes you happy inside seeing it. We walked across and back which was so nice to enjoy each other's company without toddlers wrapped around our legs. With this hotel we received a free 1 hour tour/cruise around Alcatraz and down to the Golden Gate Bridge. You also get 2 free transportation passes each day of your stay that we used for the trolley systems. Their travel system is called the MUNI and includes the trolleys or the city buses. The drivers are a great help for any questions you have. We used the trolley and buses for the Golden Gate Bridge. WE Loved the Trolleys! You can just ride with no particular destination in mind to get a feel for the city. Also great for going to the section of the city for the major shopping area (I can't remember what it's called but the area feels like New York City- very busy, hustle and bustle.) And remember the MUNI passes were free! We rented a car to go to Napa Valley to see the vineyards and Muir Woods to see the giant redwood trees. This was a nice little morning hike that my husband really enjoyed. Whatever the weather says for your trip to San Fran, take a heavy jacket/ coat. Everybody that doesn't do this buys one at the little tourist shops. (smile) Hotel was clean and a great price. However, don't count on the concierge for help. He was always covered up when we went by. This city is a must for any couple!
reviews.title: Great Stay!!

reviews.text: Great location, near lots of stuff to walk too. Concierge was EXCELLENT!!! His name was Clay, very helpful and spent lots of time with you. Has a restraunt/bar in hotel, limited italian food, but nice to sit and have a few drinks. Rooms nice, beds very comfortable!. Would stay again.
reviews.title: A great hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights on our way to New Zealand.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better
Good Location, Clean
reviews.text: Fisherman's Wharf has to be the best area for a tourist to stay in San Francisco and the Tuscan Inn is in easy walking distance of Pier 39, the Alcatraz Ferry, the main promenade of Fisherman's Wharf and the Cable Car line.

reviews.title: WOW! Cannot imagine better in the Warf!
reviews.text: Our room (2 x Double Beds) was clean and of reasonable size.

reviews.title: Great Decision to Stay Here!
reviews.text: The Foyer / Lounge was very attractive and filled with comfortable seating.

reviews.title: Bella! Wonderful Hotel!
reviews.text: The complimentary early evening (5 to 6pm) Wine reception was a nice feature - choose from 3 x wines, beer and soft drinks.

reviews.title: dobre! dobre!-----great ! great!
reviews.text: Did not try the attached Cafe Pescatore or the 24-hour fitness centre (not complimentary) that was one block away.

reviews.title: Warm and Comfortable
reviews.text: Stayed three nights and wish we could stay longer. The staff members were extra helpful, the room well decorated, detailed, clean, and bright. Liked the wine, beer, and soft drinks happy hour, the proximity to all points of interest in Fisherman's Wharf, the cable cars, grocery stores, gym, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a real find. Nice Italian restaurant in hotel, too. Watch out for steep parking rates of about $45 per night. This total includes the taxes and tips for mandatory valet parking.
reviews.title: Loved the Tuscan Inn

likes.disliked: — Really missed having a clock in the room and a small refrigerator

reviews.title: will stay again
reviews.text: Aside from the parking rate, you won't be disappointed.
Beautifully furnished rooms. Was disappointed not to have a small refrigerator or a clock radio.
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.text: Maid service was excellent ! Front desk and bell men were all very friendly and efficient. They gave out maps to help us find Chinatown, Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, as well as point out bus routes.
reviews.title: Stay away during renos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked two rooms on Priceline for $139 each, just an overnight stay while flying home the next morning. Check in was good, rooms both ready, and we upgraded with no problems. Room was very small for 4, we apparently had an "outside" room, because trucks crashed around all night loading and unloading. Tried to tip the maids for 2 extra towels as there were 4 of us and it was a HUGE problem, apparently no more than 4 towels per room? Didn't want to pay for the mini-bar, but frig leaked all over floor. When maintenance guy came in, he blamed us for turning it down, it was in a locked cabinet! Asked for a wake up call and did not get it. One male working the desk the morning of 10/20 was rushed, rude, so checked out without talking to them. Hotel is clean, very convenient to the Wharf and shopping. Would not stay here again, due to noise and staff, but ok for the price, if I would have paid rack rate, I would have been more upset.
reviews.title: Ok for the price...

reviews.text: We stayed at this lovely, incredibly well located hotel for 6 nights as we explored the hills of San Francisco. The staff was wonderful, our room was very pretty with a view of the Fisherman's Wharf area. The bathroom was marble and we had luxurious bathrobes and really, every detail attended to. When we first arrived at 2am, there had been a mixup with the room reservation and the man at the desk was so competent and accomodating - while the hotel was full, he found a room for us, for which we were eternally grateful.
reviews.title: Our comfy room at the Tuscan Inn

likes.disliked: — One night noisy out on the street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We met the manager, who was incredibly helpful about restaurants in the area, and also a lovely person to talk to. The breakfast at the neighboring restaurant (attached to the hotel) was delicious and the evening wine hour was the perfect thing after a day on one's feet. I'd highly recommend the Tuscan Inn based on location, cheerfulness of staff, aesthetics in the room and general overall service.
reviews.title: great stay at the tuscan inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed for three nights at the tuscan inn. easy walking distance to fishermans wharf , cable cars, and streetcar stop to ferry building. older hotel with smaller rooms but updated nicely. thin walled rooms. only coffee and bisquits for breakfast. overall a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Loved the wine at 5pm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights in August following a flight from UK. We had a room on the ground floor that was very well decorated but a bit gloomy. As we had come to sleep that actually helped. It was large with enough space for our cases. Disappointed with coffee making faclities.
reviews.title: Perfect Location
A Gem of a Hotel!
reviews.text: This hotel is a real gem! It is in a really good position, is not too large, and the staff are really helpful, and, contrary to what we expected on visiting America for the first time, are not waiting around for tips all the time! The furnishings are superb, rooms comfortable, and the icing on the cake was that every evening between 5 and 6pm they put on wine and beer tasting with nibbles for all the guests in the lounge! You can spend the whole hour or just pop in. Also, if you are not a breakfast person, you can just pick up a complimentary coffee and biscotori in the mornings. We only stayed for three nights, wish it had been longer!

reviews.title: Hotel Good, Beware the Breakfast!
reviews.text: For our Silver Wedding Anniversary we decided to go round the world, & one stop, albeit only for 2 nights, was San Francisco. We've used Best Western hotels quite a lot, so had no fear of booking the Tuscan Inn. Reviews on-line were generally favourable - as is ours.

We arrived on the evening of december 5th, and the check-in staff were helpful and efficient. The room was a fair distance from the elevator, but adequate, and no different to most others in this class of hotel as far as amenities went. Our room looked out onto a very small internal courtyard, & plants and flowers made it quite pleasant, but one had to be careful about the shutters because other guests could see into the room. The reverse applied, of course!
reviews.title: Loved the Tuscan Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning, we went down to the adjacent restaurant, which had been in prior publicity material, for breakfast. We didn't enjoy it, because some of the staff seemed to have little English, and misunderstood our requests. We were given saute potatoes that were inedible because they were so hard and undercooked, and the coffee wasn't so good, either. We sent the potatoes back, and the bill was reduced by a small amount. The Eagle Cafe on Pier 39 is a far better bet, and has a view of Alcatraz whilst you're eating.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the hotel's safety deposit without any problems, and the checkout was good and swiftly done. The hotel is quite close to Fisherman's Wharf and the terminus of one of the Cable-car lines, and also close to the streetcar line, so getting into the city centre was easy. The general area that the hotel is in is a bit scruffy. The only quibble we had with the Tuscan Inn was that outside our room was a large cupboard, and staff kept going in there, made quite a noise, and finished off by banging the door. Overall it was quite good, but not so good as to be a 'must go back' sort of place. We paid £172 (stg) for our two night stay.
reviews.title: I Left My Heart.....

likes.disliked: — Ask for a room in the back. Very quiet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I chose this Hotel for out New Year's Eve "gettaway" based on the great reviews from Trip Advisor and we were not dissapointed! I booked a standard king room and was up graded to a premier king free of charge upon our arrival. The staff were very nice. The wine hour in the cozy lobby was great. Enjoyed talking with fellow travelers by the warm and inviting fireplace. Our room was very nice. We expected the room to be small based on all the reviews but it was very nicely decorated and super clean. The bed was very comfortable and the room itself was very quiet. The hotel is walking distance to many attractions. We ate at the Italian restaraunt located in the hotel and the food and service was outstanding. Check out the following morning was fast and flawless as we enjoyed fresh coffee and biscotti served complimentary in the lobby. I will go back to this hotel again!
reviews.title: A great place to stay in San Francisco!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at this hotel awhile back, I sort of knew what to expect. Check in was flawless, and we were even early arrivals at approx 12 noon. Room was on 4th floor overlooking the interior garden area. Seems the hotel has been completely renovated since our last stay. Our room had a nice clean bath/shower, all tile, and sink that was marble. Plenty of toiletries. The bed was very plush, and king size that was very comfortable. There were 2 alarm clocks on either side of the bed. Nice mini bar, and plenty of tv stations to watch before going to bed. The rooms are done in an Italian hue, and recently new carpet through out the entire hotel and our floor. The refridge was a bit noisy, and the air conditioner seemed a bit loud and woke me several times during the night, but really was not bad at all. Never experienced the room service. Never did partake in the 5 pm wine tasting as we were usually out at the Buena Vista chugging down Irish coffee until the late night. The hotel is very well located as previously mentioned in other reviews. We ate dinner at the attached restaurant the night prior to our departure for convenience, and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food. Well done. All in all, would and have stayed here again. Paid around 205 a night booked through a hotel vendor website. It is very "touristy" by the wharf. As other times we have stayed more in the financial district, and probably would the next time for a different feel again.
reviews.title: Again, a nice quaint hotel, perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 week vacation incorporating 6 days in California followed by a cruise.
reviews.title: Great time in San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the Best Western Tuscan Inn as our base whilst in San Francisco on the first three nights of our tour.
reviews.title: A Great Stay

reviews.text: We arrived at SFR approximately 1 hour late due to flight delays at London Heathrow and in the pouring rain and, of course, suffering from jet lag. Despite all this, we found the Tuscan Inn easily in a city strange to us.
reviews.title: Very Dog-Friendly

likes.disliked: — tried to charge extra, rather than my quoted AAA rate

reviews.text: The location is excellent right in the centre of fishermans wharf, a few minutes walk to all the major attractions and cable car. The rooms are comfortable, clean and nicely furnished. The bathroom was clean but a little dated. The staff at check-in were nice enough, but unfortunately the concierge was not very helpful, giving us wrong information about our car hire location causing us to get 2 cab rides instead of one. Not good with heavy luggage! We did not sample the evening wine reception, as it's a bit early if you are out sightseeing. The tea, coffee and biscotti in the morning however, was a nice touch. Good value hotel for the location.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: I cannot praise this hotel highly enough. We chose the hotel because of the reviews on this site and we weren't disappointed. The location of the hotel was fantastic it takes a couple of minutes to walk to pier 39 and is right next to the tram stop to take you into the main shopping areas. I really don't know where the "ghetto" was as mentioned in another review because I always felt perfectly safe. I think that SF has a problem with vagrants in general and they were not especially prevelant around the hotel. The reason that I liked this hotel so much was that it felt cosy and welcoming, the lobby had a log fire going constantly and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. The free beer, wine etc and snacks on an afternoon was a lovely touch and helped you swap tips and chat to other guests. The rooms were very nice - it wasn't the usual beige hotel room which made a nice change. The only thing wrong with the room was the bathroom, it was not up to the standard of the rest of the decor but it was clean and large enough. The restaurant that adjoins the hotel was excellent - the prices were reasonable and the food was very good.
reviews.title: a wonderful hotel

reviews.text: Just one tip... regardless of the hotel you stay in I would thoroughly recommend the bike hire that allows you to bike over the golden gate bridge. We spent a glorious morning exploring the bay area on our own and the bike paths made it very safe and easy to do.
reviews.title: Perfect place

reviews.text: On the 30th anniversary of our marriage my wife went on the internet and arranged a week in California. We flew from Philadelphia to San Francisco and arrived at the Tuscan Inn at Fisherman Warf in the early afternoon. The front desk treated us like royalty. Our room was tastefully decorated in white and yellow. It was so cheery and felt like a bed and breakfast room. We could walk everywhere and felt right at home when we returned in the evening. We would recommend this location for anyone who wanted to be close to all attractions. Don't hesitate, try it.
reviews.title: Great Location and comfort

reviews.text: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn for one night in August 2005. I chose this property for its proximity to Fisherman's Wharf and the Blue and Gold Ferry to Alcatraz. It was an easy 5 minute walk to both of these as well as the Cable car line. Dinner in the hotel restaurant was excellent and the beds were very comfortable. I was also pleased with the wireless internet access. paid $161 plus tax along with a $20 parking fee.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!
Enjoyed our stay at the Tuscan Inn
reviews.text: This is the first time we stayed at the Tuscan Inn, our room was very nicely furnished and the bathroom was neat and shiny. The location was great for sight seeing and visiting the many restaurants close by. The social hour between 5 and 6 p.m. was a nice touch. We met a very nice couple from Vancouver (even though the U.S. Olympic Hockey team got beat by Canada the Sunday we were there). The restaurant serves a very nice breakfast.

Booked after checking out on Trip and looked okay. When Amercans say small rooms you normally imagine they will be bigger than european sizes but this is no bigger. Facilities in room average but could do with better cupboard space.
reviews.title: Nice Place - Shame about the size

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Coffee in the lounge fair but would be better if you could brew up in your room. Wine party great novelty and nice drop off and change stop before going out for the evening.
reviews.title: Some Nice Touches

reviews.text: Only thing to remember is the bin men collect at ungodly oclock so road facing rooms get disturbed.
reviews.title: A good place to stay at Fisherman's Wharf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed 3 nights at the Tuscan Inn and enjoyed every minute. We got a late internet deal but even so this hotel was not cheap by comparison to others in this area. However it is in a great position, one block from all Waterfront attractions, and throws in some nice little extras that actually made it good value for money. These included discount vouchers for the attached Italian restaurant and free wine tasting (max 2 glasses) and pizza (from the restaurant) between 5 and 6 pm every evening. For good reason was this hotel recently given an award for it's standard of service.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel with a great restaurant and convenient to many locations
A Mixed Bag
reviews.text: You can't beat the location with a stick, but the "suite" was awfully small. The thermostat gave us a choice of baste or chill until frosty.

reviews.title: this is the place
reviews.text: At $80-100 this is a 4 star but at $150 a night I was looking for a little more.

reviews.title: tuscan inn was wonderful
reviews.text: the tuscan inn was a great place to spend a week since it is located away from the noise and action of the wharf but also close to the cable cars to travel around the city. our early flight arrival actually let us into the room before check in which was the first of many pluses of this hotel. the hotel has a wine hour each day which is a great way to relax after a day of touring and also meet others. friendly service was evident each day and the gentleman conceirge was patient and helpful. there is a grocery store right around the corner which was nice to grab some juice and pastry rather than a full scale breakfast. i could not recommend this place more and will return to the tuscan on my next vacation to california.

reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay
reviews.text: we stayed here for 3 nights last week. the rooms are small but very nice. the staff was very friendly and the location is great. got the "best rate" and it was a good deal.

reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!
reviews.text: Really enjoyed the Tuscan Inn. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Coffee in the morning was great. "Happy hour" from 5-6 was a great touch. We enjoyed drinking wine and meeting some of the other guests. Very close to Fishermans Wharf. Basically 2 blocks or so to the water. The only minor downside, as a few others have mentioned, is the bathroom/sink lighting. Room is a little small, but was totally fine for two people with two full sized suit cases. We will stay at this same hotel the next time we are in San Fran.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked into this hotel after a long flight from Florida. They were very efficient at the reservation desk and surprised us with an upgrade to a suite. The rooms seemed to have been recently renovated with updated decor. They were very comfortable and quite attractive. The bed was perfect as were the pillows. (I always carry travel down pillows, but didn't even unpack them.) The wine reception in the late afternoon is a nice extra. The bathroom was adequate with thick, fluffy towels. If I had any complaints, it would be that there could be a larger sink area to hold cosmetics.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel. It is a great value.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights,our room was on the fourth floor and adequately big enough for the three of us, my husband and adult daughter.The staff were friendly and helpful,it was a good base from which to explore San Francisco.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel & Location

reviews.text: We took an evening Alcatraz tour and a City tour with Shuttle tours which I would recommend if you have limited time in town.
reviews.title: LOVED IT!!

reviews.text: The Best Western in Fishermans Wharf is a fabulous hotel and an ideal base to enjoy your trip to San Francisco.
reviews.title: Great location and staff !

likes.liked: — Log fire and morning and evening complimentary refreshments

reviews.text: Nice hotel and was close to everything. Only had a couple minor complaints. First, there was noise from garbage trucks early in the am on the first night and loud people causing a ruckus outside the following night. Neither occurance is really the hotel's fault. But, as others have indicated in their ratings/reviews, get a room that faces the courtyard if you are a light sleeper. Second, the shower curtain did not work well and we had puddles of water on the bathroom floor after each shower. Beyond that the hotel was nice and clean and the staff took care of any needs we had. The lcoation was great for sightseeing.
reviews.title: Liked it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location if you like busy areas. It is very close to fisherman's wharf near all the action - restaurants, souvenir shops, pier 39, ferry departures and the cable car. As the hotel is located in the street parallel to fisherman's wharf you don't hear the noise from outside.
reviews.title: Fine hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is nice and the staff we met was friendly. The room was smaller than we're used to and there was no view. The room was clean and the bed were comfortable. The value for money is a bit low as you mainly pay for the location.
reviews.title: Fun location and they LOVE pets!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very comfortable, quaint property in an excellent location. The rooms are a little small but very comfortable and a great value.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: I really appreciate being able to bring my two bichon frise's. They even have doggie treats in the lobby. We didn't have to pay extra to have the pets with us. Our dogs loved walking around Pier 39 and the Wharf. If you are planning to bring your doggies, this is an excellent choice. I highly recommend.
reviews.title: The perfect hotel on Fisherman's Wharf...

reviews.text: Stayed for two nights, there were six of us in three rooms. We all had the same great opinion of this property. Very clean and well maintained through-out. It was an easy walk to the bus stops and Fisherman's Wharf areas. There was a Trader Joes and Safeway within a block of the hotel to buy snacks and such. The adjacent Cafe Pescatero was handy for breakfast but had some hiccups in service, but it was okay overall. We would highly recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: My sister and I stayed at the Tuscan Inn over the weekend. It is a great hotel - clean and comfortable. We had a courtyard view, and there was NO noise at night. A lot of the people staying there were older and very quiet. I would DEFINITELY stay there again. It was a couple of blocks from the warf. The streets in San Fran were filthy and the homeless people were scary, but the hotel was wonderful!!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!

likes.liked: — It was so quiet at night. Comfortable beds. Clean!
likes.disliked: — Front desk help. Some were friendly - some not...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Tuscan (THe first was 10 years ago). It is a wonderful clean place to stay and but two short blocks to Fisherman's Wharf. Earily evening free wine tasting (or wine drinking- they give you a full glass af several wines). In the morning free great coffee and biscotti in the lobby- with carry-out cups.
reviews.title: Great place to lay your head and tour from

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was always cleaned but they only give out 2 towels? I guess you only get one towel per day.
reviews.title: Loved the Tuscan Inn
Tuscan Inn 2 blocks from the Piers
reviews.text: It was interesting that we received a better room price by going thru Travelocity then by calling the hotel direct???

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn, because its walking distance to the Cruise Pier. We were going on a cruise and wanted to be close to cruise terminal. Not only close, but in the Fishermans Wharf area, did not need to rent car, public transportation out front. Our room was very nice and comfy, only complain about room was it was too small. Would stay here again, event hough they did not know what they did with our luggage when we checked out, but I am trying to work with them now about it, we eventually found it, but the experience was not great. (lack of communication and very unhelpful about it on there end)
reviews.title: Would stay here again, eventhough we had an issue

likes.disliked: — Lack of communcation between front desk and bell hops

reviews.text: Hotels in SF are not cheap,and room sizes are not overly big,so a pretty tiny room for $180 was no big surprise. Valet parking for $40 per night seems a bit steep,but at least the service was efficient and quick.
reviews.title: Reasonable value for money

reviews.text: Overall the Tuscan Inn is a nice hotel. very clean,well maintained,with efficient,if not overly friendly service. the couple of faults with room features were fixed very quickly,which was a nice change from the interminable wait often suffered in European properties.
reviews.title: Nice hotel!
Beautiful Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel makes a big thing of the coffee/bisc service in the morning,and this is quite nice. I'd say that,as far as the evening (5 to 6 ) wine service is concerned,if you happen to be in the hotel,it's fine. But not worth rushing back from a day out for.
Breakfast was OK,but expensive. Much better option is Pats Cafe,just round the corner nr the cable car terminus.
reviews.title: Great stay

likes.disliked: — expensive restaurant for what it was

reviews.text: All the negatives are true. Something good to say.... I liked the blinds and they helped block out the noise from our "quiet courtyard" room overlooking the noisy street. The valets/bellhops were excellent. If you get a cheap rate here, have low expectations and are sound sleepers, then this is good for location to Fisherman's Wharf attractions. The room was clean enough. Our reservations were completely wrong and staff were clueless, so I thought, until further inquiries proved that they were lying through their teeth. One morning I overheard people booking in experiencing similar difficluties and a staff member trying to be helpful, I offered some assistance and we were told by him that since Best Western shifted its booking facility offshore there's nothing that Tuscan Inn staff can do to help guests.
reviews.title: Try elsewhere

reviews.text: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn last weekend, and found it perfect for our needs. We were able to walk lots of great places, we did not take the cable car because the lines were so long, but it was easy to get to. It was very easy to find a cab when we needed one. The staff was very friendly, we had no issues at all with the front desk. The mini bar fridge was set too low - a bottle of beer actually exploded, and although we called housekeeping for some new towels no one ever arrived. I happened to go up to our room when the housekeeping staff was out in force - every single woman I passed said hello to me! I usually have trouble sleeping in hotels, but I was able to open the window (I need that street noise that others complain about!) and get some fresh air, and the bed was very comfy.
reviews.title: Great location
Good location - and that's it
reviews.text: A complete disappointment - from losing the reservation made through Best Western toll-free number ("our computer crashed when receiving reservations from BW" - lame) to charging our credit card for someone elses stay 3 WEEKS AFTER WE LEFT! There appears to be no management actively involved with running this dump, cause when we asked to speak with one the front desk staff got very nervous and suddenly worked hard to find our lost reservation. Dont let the "free" wine and biscotti fool you. There is a Holiday Inn Express exactly one block away.

We recently spent 3 nights at the Tuscan. Nice, medium sized hotel in a good location. Walking distance to all Fishermans's Wharf attractions, cable cars, etc. Very good Italian resturant attached (forgot the name). Wine tastings each afteroon. The staff is friendly and helpful. The room is medium size, clean and comfortable. I SUGGEST YOU REQUEST A COURTYARD ROOM TO AVOID THE STREET NOISE. This IS a city!
reviews.title: Great Hotel !!

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location in terms of a walking distance to key Fisherman's Wharf attractions. From the Wharf area you can catch a trolley car or sightseeing bus to other parts of the City.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel in good location. On checking young lady at reception decided to take a phone call and leave us standing there with no instruction for 5 mins. Her colleague eventually took over and handed us our room keys.......okay ! what room where we what floor were we on, no communication, so first impressions not good. The room was very clean and modern abit on the small side, but overlooking the courtyard was better than overlooking a road. Wine tasting is served between 5pm-6pm which is great after a long day sight seeing. On check out again, we had a rude receptionist, as you can be charged to use your room safe or ask for it to be waivered. I asked for it to be waivered and the reply was 'that was not my question miss' oh dear someone got out of the wrong side of bed.....So yeah great hotel, but beware of the two grumpy staff,the others seemed fine when observing.
reviews.title: Great Location,Reception Staff Rude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Tuscan Inn was a GREAT place for us to stop after a long flight from the East Coast and on our way to Hawaii. The room was spotless! The amenities were so much more than we'd expected! (although I DID read the reviews on TripAdvisor before booking!). The restaurant attached had a wonderful breakfast menu - everyone was very friendly and helpful. The location was ideal - walk to Pier 39, restaurants, shops, grocery, etc. The tour bus company picked us up right at the door. The only way to have made it better, would have been to stay a couple of days more.
reviews.title: Wished we could have stayed longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've already decided to return to the Tuscan the next time we make our way back to Hawaii!
reviews.title: Within Walking Distance of Fisherman's Wharf

reviews.text: Thanks for such a relaxing and comfortable couple of nights!
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The convenience of walking to all the Fisherman's Wharf attractions, made this the perfect hotel. We had a car, so the room+parking package saved us quite a bit. The staff was efficient and friendly. There is a free public computer in the lobby and free wine tasting in the afternoon. Breakfast was not included in our package, but there were many places to eat close by.
reviews.title: We would stay here again!
Great Location
reviews.text: I spent two nights at this hotel. It is about a 5 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Good base for exploring local sights. Generally very quiet hotel.

reviews.title: Oh my gosh, the Best beds!
reviews.text: Wine at 5 pm was a nice treat.
Room was slightly bigger than a typical room.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
Jerks
reviews.text: While I have no substantive complaints about this hotel, areas for improvement include:
$29/day to park a car seems like a lot to me.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic choice, 10 days at the Tuscan, location is wonderful only a couple of blocks from pier 39. The Coffee and Biscotti in the morning were a nice touch, and the wine tasting every evening became a must get back to the hotel for. Room spacious 2 double beds gave us plenty of room, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was a good size. there is a bar up the road if you are a sports fan at the grand hyatt which is worth a visit. Overall a fantastic time was had there and i look forward to returning A+++++++++++++
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was absolutely lovely, although dresser drawers and closet were small. The bed was very comfortable. Windows don't open - so no fresh air. Internet is free. I needed something printed two different times, and after following their directions I went to the front desk and was able to get it right away. There is a small refrigerator, but it was stocked so very little space for our own "goodies". The location is perfect - two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and only a block to the street car and trolley. The bathroom was large and included a mounted makeup mirror. Towels were large and soft. The shampoo, conditioner, soap and lotion they provide is heavenly! Coffeemaker in the room and when "regular" coffee wasn't left one day, it was delivered immediately when I requested it. Lots and lots of restaurants nearby. We had a wonderful time and would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect Location and Lovely Inn

reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. I was on a strict budget for my trip to SF and was thrilled to get this hotel for $59 on Priceline (off season, and between conventions, I did my homework). The hotel is perfectly located in my opinion: close to Fisherman's Wharf, but away from the crowds; within a very short walk to North Beach (an absolute must see); literally around the corner from the cable cars (buy a multi day pass-much cheaper); stores and restaurants closeby; excellent transportation connections besides the cable car. The hotel itself is elegant, but not stuffy. One of the friendliest desk/concierge staffs I've encountered (they made a luggage tag, mapped out driving directions, gave bus/trolley directions, gracious with special requests, wine & cheese hour etc). The rooms are abit smallish (absolutely typical of SF), but immaculately maintained, and tastefully decorated, with excellent bathroom facilities. One stand out example: the painter who was touching up nicks on the hall mouldings, cheerfully greeted me in the morning on my way out. I am a budget traveller who has travelled all over the world, and this hotel is one of my top five picks for best value (just don't pay rack rate). This hotel is managed by the Kimpton folks and they do a great job for the price.
reviews.title: Tuscan Inn was incredible

likes.liked: — location, transportation options, friendly staff, decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tuscan Inn has it all, exellant location,very close to public transport, very clean, impeccable, friendly service and a supermarket opposite. Our king bed room was quite overlooking the courtyard and the decor lovely. The complimentary toiletries, coffee and biscotti and the happy hour drinks each eveing just go to prove they go the extra mile.
reviews.title: Terrific stay at the Tuscan Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: bus pick us up every morning at the hotel and they did an
reviews.title: Perfect locatin for exploring the city

reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights in early August before heading to the Tenaya Lodge in Yosemite. The hotel was clean and decorated nicely, and biscotti and coffee in the morning was nice. Staff was friendly. The rooms and the double beds were very small, both quite a bit smaller than the Tenaya.
reviews.title: Hotel OK, good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked two connecting rooms since we were travelling with our boys, ages 11 & 15, and I called several days prior to arriving to remind them of our request. At check-in, they had our kids in a room at the end of the hallway, which we were not comfortable with. We took just one room for that night and they moved us to adjacent, though not connecting, rooms the next two nights. This was much better and gave us a lot more space. Beware, if you request adjoining rooms, they are not guaranteed and really not even planned. They told me they don't assign rooms until the day of check-in, and they were also overbooked.
reviews.title: Nearby the Wharf and Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Tuscan Inn is in a great location in Fishermen's Wharf and our boys really enjoyed Pier 39. I'm glad we stayed in FW instead of downtown - much more for kids to do there.
reviews.title: Great location, clean rooms, we enjoyed our visit....

likes.disliked: — one room was very bright at night and musty smelling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Tuscan Inn is run by the Kimpton Hotel group and therefore a step above the typical Best Western. The hotel is very clean and modern. Our room was decorated with white wood shutters and accents of black and red. It was quaint and nice sized. The bed was comfortable and the views were overlooking the street and the bay, from our corner room.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the wine in the afternoon

likes.liked: — Location for ferries and transport links

reviews.text: There was coffee and biscotti in the lobby daily. We also used the convenient shopping across the street to buy some bagels at Safeway which we stored in the bar refrigerator. Then we picked up the free lobby coffee and the WSJ and the USA Today newspapers, thus having a cheap breakfast. There's also a Trader Joes and Cost Plus just a block away.
reviews.title: PA Traveler

likes.liked: — Location to the Wharf and Cable Cars

reviews.text: PROS
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The location is wonderful. Two short blocks to the cable cars, 1 block to the electrics trolleys and steps to the bus. We never used our car to explore the city. Pier 39, Fisherman’s Wharf, the Cannery and Ghirardelli all an easy walk (with kids).
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Our room was very quiet as well. It was nice not having to listen to cars and buses throughout the night or other guest.
reviews.title: Good Location
Great Hotel!
reviews.text: CONS

We were initially given a smoking room although I requested nonsmoking and then the desk clerk argued with me that it was not a smoking room, but just on a smoking floor… there was an ashtray in the room. They did switch rooms eventually and even the bellhop thought it smelled horrid in the room.
reviews.title: Great location at a reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived early after a 12 hour flight and a 21 hour time switch (NZ to San Francisco) - feeling like zombies. The room was ready! Really needed a shower but there was a bit of a hot water shortage early afternoon. More tepid than hot. This isn't unusual in hotels. It was fine the next morning. The rooms are small by American standards and it wasn't helped by the presence of a fairly large and noisy fridge which we weren't given a key to. We ended up unplugging it, which was easier said than done. The hotel doesn't provide coffee and tea making facilities in the room but it is available to take away in the lobby from around 7 a.m. to 10 a.m. We actually found this more useful, especially as you could use the internet at the same time. There is also a wine hour from 5 to 6pm in the lobby. Free wine and free pizza. It was a great way to meet other guests. The hotel has a great location. A few minutes walk from Pier 39 and the wharf area, a short stroll from the F-line trolley cars and one block from the Powell and Mason St. cable car turnaround. There are plenty of restaurants nearby and we also tried the Cafe Pescatore at the hotel. The food was very good but the portions are more European than American.
reviews.title: Good location and mainly friendly staff. Rooms are small
